channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 387,000 and there are more than 6.5 million cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 6.5 million as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: As Black Lives Matter protests grow across the US over policing, the deep economic inequalities that African-Americans face are coming to the forefront.
item.title: The black-white economic divide in the US is as wide as it was in 1968

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The state government needs to recommence subsidising cheap flights to Exmouth and Broome to prevent airlines price gouging West Australians who want to holiday in regional towns, the state opposition says.
item.title: Will airlines hike up WA flight prices amid interstate and international travel bans?

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: George Floyd's death at the hands of Minneapolis police has sparked widespread unrest in the United States with more than 40 cities in lockdown and demonstrations across the country.
item.title: George Floyd protests LIVE: Minneapolis to hold memorial service as protests continue across the US

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: A Perth nightlife institution is set for a multi-million dollar facelift as part of a plan to create an entertainment precinct in a trendy Leederville block.
item.title: Leederville nightlife institution set for multi million-dollar facelift

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Santos boss Kevin Gallagher visited Devil Creek and Varanus Island in WA's north west to attend sites earlier this week and meet with employees after WA Police granted him an exemption to enter the state
item.title: Union fumes after oil and gas CEO gets exemption to drop into WA without isolating

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX poised to retreat at open

item.description: Derek Chauvin, the police officer who pinned his knee into Floyd's neck for nearly nine minutes is charged with second-degree murder.
item.title: Bail set at $US1 million for US officers in George Floyd case

item.description: The drug was controversial in part because US President Donald Trump repeatedly promoted their use and took hydroxychloroquine himself to try to prevent infection.
item.title: Study on safety of malaria drugs for coronavirus retracted

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: A group of four men allegedly arrived at the Didbrook Street home in Robertson on the night of April 29, where a 38-year-old man was shot in the leg.
item.title: Police charge two after April shooting south of Brisbane

item.description: A former Marine general said that events on Monday, the day Trump walked to the church, "may well signal the beginning of the end of the American experiment".
item.title: Troops to leave Washington as another general airs concerns about Trump

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: A man and woman in their 70s had been in the Acacia Ridge home last night when the blaze broke out. He was later found dead inside.
item.title: Neighbour helps woman escape fatal Brisbane house fire

item.description: The S&P 500 lost ground as investors took profits in advance of Friday's jobs report, ending a four-day rally driven by rising economic sentiment.
item.title: S&P slides lower to end four-day rally

item.description: Bernard Madoff, who defrauded investors of more than $US19 billion in history's biggest Ponzi scheme, won't be released early from his 150-year prison sentence.
item.title: Ponzi scheme mastermind Bernie Madoff denied compassionate release from jail

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: A 420 per cent increase in controversial procedures to snip "tongue-tie" in babies has prompted a coalition of professionals to warn parents against unnecessary and potentially life-threatening surgery.
item.title: Tongue-tie controversy: Experts caution against unnecessary surgery

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates sees a way to ensure that poorer regions won't be left behind in the rush for COVID-19 vaccines: invest in factories all over the world.
item.title: Bill Gates investing in factories to immunise the world

item.description: Later this northern summer Facebook will also block any ads from such outlets that target US users, it said on Thursday.
item.title: Facebook to label Russia's Sputnik, Iran's Press TV and China's Xinhua News

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Australians flying home predominantly from Pakistan and India are the only confirmed COVID-19 cases recorded in NSW for more than a week.
item.title: Carry-on COVID-19: plane passengers unknowingly importing the virus

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Protests across the US

item.description: The British girl who disappeared in Portugal in 2007 is assumed to be dead and an imprisoned German child abuser is the murder suspect, a prosecutor says.
item.title: Madeleine McCann is assumed dead, German prosecutor says

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: A court is weighing up a settlement offer that would see residents keep only $126 million of their landmark $212 million payout.
item.title: Bitter split over toxic foam payout as legal costs slammed

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: A Productivity Commission report has found the skills sector is "underperforming, excessively complicated and suffers from ad hoc policy approaches".
item.title: Governments challenged to shake up 'Byzantine' vocational education system

item.description: Wilkes was instrumental in introducing a Major in Australian literature to Sydney University.
item.title: Scholar brought Australian literature to a wider audience

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: As he prepares to take on his former Cronulla teammates for the first time, cross-code star Valentine Holmes opens up on his departure from the Shire.
item.title: 'I could have handled it better': Holmes opens up on Cronulla exit

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: The NSW Premier had a close relationship with former NRL chief Todd Greenberg — but ARLC chair V'landys is used to getting his way.
item.title: V'landys versus Berejiklian in stadium showdown

item.description: Stereotypes about the 'ideal worker' are doing men a disservice if they have priorities outside of the office.
item.title: What kind of man only works part time?

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Training companies hide course prices in Australia's complex $6.1 billion a year TAFE and vocational education sector. As a result too many students pay too much for their courses, a Productivity Commission reviews finds.
item.title: Why a Queensland TAFE-trained nurse can pay $14,000 more than in Victoria

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Just under two-thirds of creative and performing arts workers relied on JobKeeper payments in April, after coronavirus shut down the industry.
item.title: 'Helped us enormously': arts sector received $100m from government in April

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, June 5

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The telco's boss Kevin Russell says NBN wholesale prices and performance will both need to improve as the network rollout nears completion.
item.title: Vocus says NBN pricing still not fit for purpose

item.description: There is a triple whammy facing women at work during the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Pandemic has impacted women most significantly

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Ken Crispin, QC, a former judge and top prosecutor, says the video is on its face "evidence of an assault".
item.title: 'Bad day' no defence in arrest of Indigenous teen: former judge

item.dc:creator: Samantha Selinger-Morris
item.description: The pandemic has brought new stresses to mental health care workers. It might also help dispel the stigma that they never need help.
item.title: Therapists face 'unusual' struggle triggered by remote sessions

item.dc:creator: Tony Shepherd
item.description: The private sector provides 90 per cent of jobs in NSW. I am not aware of any offering across-the-board pay rises. In many businesses, there are pay cuts.
item.title: The case for a public service pay freeze: ask what you can do for your state

item.description: It is easy for us to notice racism when it is as blatant as the death of George Floyd.
item.title: Quiet Australians must speak up to end racism

item.dc:creator: John Hewson
item.description: When I proposed gas as a transition fuel 30 years ago, the numbers stacked up. Now the numbers back renewables.
item.title: Banking on gas will leave us stranded

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Guaranteed laughs straight through your headphones.
item.title: Top five classic comedy albums to stream on Spotify

item.dc:creator: Janine Perrett
item.description: Passion, compassion and laughter were the hallmarks of this talented journalist, who fled a divided America in the early 1970s to call Australia home.
item.title: The larger than life newsman with a big-hearted talent

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: A singer wasn’t a singer, the fighting Skeens, and crocs selling like hot cakes
item.title: In the Herald: June 5, 1954

item.description: I do not have a crystal ball, but I can help students decide what to do after they leave school.
item.title: 'Futures program' takes the angst out of career planning

item.description: The Herald joined silent film star Vera James at the Sydney Film Festival for a screening of her 1921 debut, A Girl of the Bush.
item.title: From the Archives, 1975: Out of the silents, a flashback to 1921

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, June 5

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: The former prime minister has requested the US social media behemoth remove multiple foul-mouthed accounts that bear his name, but Twitter has refused.
item.title: 'Agents of misrepresentation': Keating slams Twitter for parody accounts

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: The Property Council is pushing a $1.7b economic rescue plan that would triple the first home owner grant and suspend stamp duty payments for three years.
item.title: Proposal to triple first home owner grant, defer stamp duty as recession hits

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 5, 2020

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: State government urges protesters to stay home as police are threatened with spitting, inflammatory chanting and other forms of physical abuse at Saturday's Black Lives Matter protest.
item.title: Activists 'plan trouble' for Melbourne Black Lives Matter protest

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: The government is refusing to reveal how many times it met with Maurice Blackburn as it pushed ahead with legislation allowing lawyers to charge contingency fees.
item.title: Government hush on meetings with class action firm ahead of reform bill

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Victoria needs billions to ease the "major trauma" of stamp duty reform but the Commonwealth is not keen to pay.
item.title: Federal cash key to wean Victoria off stamp duty and payroll tax, says Pallas

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: The chaos of the COVID-19 crisis has exposed deep flaws in the way Australia regulates medical equipment, critics say.
item.title: Coronavirus 'exposing deep flaws' in Australia's medical device regulation
